properties.areaDesc: Aiken; McCormick; McDuffie; Kershaw; Chesterfield; Fairfield; Northern Lancaster; Southern Lancaster; Richmond; Lincoln; Newberry; Columbia; Saluda; Lexington; Richland; Edgefield
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 6 at 4:06AM EST until February 7 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Flash Flood Watch...

.A strong and slow moving cold front will bring heavy rain to
central South Carolina and the Central Savannah River Area of
Georgia today through tonight.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina,
including the following areas, in east central Georgia,
Columbia, Lincoln, McDuffie, and Richmond. In central South
Carolina, Aiken, Chesterfield, Edgefield, Fairfield, Kershaw,
Lexington, McCormick, Newberry, Northern Lancaster, Richland,
Saluda, and Southern Lancaster.

* From 7 AM EST this morning through late tonight

* Soils remain saturated from the recent wet period. Rainfall
totals from 2 to 3 inches are expected through tonight. Locally
higher amounts may occur leading to flash flooding.

* Rapid rises are expected on streams and creeks. Additionally,
water will quickly pond in areas of poor-drainage. This will
lead to the threat of roadways becoming flooded, especially this
afternoon and evening.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

Do not attempt to drive on flooded roads. It takes little water
to move a vehicle off the road and into deeper water. On foot,
keep away from storm drains.

Owners of small ponds should monitor pond levels and dam
integrity.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT
